page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY(664-1308)
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY {664 The village of Upton(up=upon a { hill,ton=village)first appeared { in the Charter of Wulfhere { although it was not recorded in { the original Domesday Book. {1146 Ascelin de Waterville was { recorded as the freeholder as the { Watervilles traditionally held { much of the land in that area. { This holding was confirmed for a { decsendant,Hugh de Waterville,by { Richard I and,later,by Henry III { The land was then passed,through { marriage,to Ralph Carnoys and { then later it was sold illegally { to a woman called Eleanor who is { recorded as a Queen. {1290 Upton Manor was passed with { Torpel Manor to Peterborough { Abbey. {1308 Upton Manor and other Manors were
